column1: What may be the reason for their situation ? [SEP] Well , after reading around , I came to the conclusion that it 's merely media influence . column2: It is their job to influence the public .

[SEP]  (A) They enjoyed the strawberry ice cream cone . (B) They loved the cone filled with chocolate . (C) They loved the vanilla cone . (D) None of the above choices .

column1: What could the kids do to help ? [SEP] I had a testimony that had dwindled . For 2 weeks in my PJ 's , I was in my bed reading . Kids playing on the floor wondering what was happening . [SEP]  (A) None of the above choices . (B) Have fun . (C) Play on the floor . (D) Give a hug .
column2: Give a hug .

column1: What best describe 's the lovely 's stature ? [SEP] Quicky med report ... Just wanted to report on a really good day . My lovey did a great job on the outside stairs today with the physical therapist , then he practiced driving . He did n't drive terribly far -- just to the end of the street and back but he did drive . He said it felt weird but he had n't driven in four full months so weird would be expected . Then after all that , he walked a little with NO WALKER OR CANE . [SEP]  (A) They have a physical disability (B) None of the above choices . (C) They have a mental disability (D) They are a paraplegic
column2: They have a physical disability

column1: What happened to the defendants after nine years of their Ponzi scheme ? [SEP] Moreover , like a classic Ponzi scheme , the Defendants transferred approximately $ 2.8 million from new clients to existing clients to repay principal or to create the illusion of profitable trading . In addition , to facilitate and otherwise conceal their fraud , the complaint alleges that the Defendants provided clients with false account statements reflecting securities holdings and returns that did not exist . This was an interesting scheme , it lasted almost nine years . And it appears to have returned half the mark 's money . [SEP]  (A) They started another , more lucrative , Ponzi scheme . (B) They were caught , arrested and put on trial . (C) They returned the money and went into hiding . (D) None of the above choices .
column2: They were caught , arrested and put on trial .

column1: What do you know about her ? [SEP] She was always smiling , always happy , for no apparent reason . laughing even when no one was making jokes , just loving life so much . I envied her . [SEP]  (A) She was wild (B) She was funny (C) She was optimistic (D) None of the above choices .
column2: She was optimistic

column1: What might have happened if the writer had n't gone to the hospital ? [SEP] " , " BITER ! ! ! " , and " GET HELP ! ! ! ! ! [SEP]  (A) They might have had more time to go dumpster diving . (B) None of the above choices . (C) They might have gotten better more quickly . (D) They might have developed an infection .
column2: They might have developed an infection .

column1: Why did their mother respond this way ? [SEP] Every time I ask her , " Ma , what 's your favourite animal ? " she would be sure to reply , " Little kids ! " I just do n't get it ! If she saw pretty flowers , she would definitely buy them ! [SEP]  (A) They think little kids are as wild as animals . (B) None of the above choices . (C) They are the parent of a lot of children . (D) They own animals and children .
column2: They think little kids are as wild as animals .

column1: What type of people would return a puppy because it was too much like a puppy ? [SEP] But I live and work in the trenches , and I will tell you that most people that work in animal welfare will tell you that they would take in a 10 year old dog than a 10 week old puppy . Yesterday , we had a family who adopted a puppy last week come in wanting to return the puppy . The reason ? It was being a puppy . [SEP]  (A) A person who helps fun animal welfare units because they love animals . (B) People who love animals too much to keep an unhappy puppy . (C) None of the above choices . (D) People who would do anything to make sure animals are not harmed .
column2: None of the above choices .

column1: Why is the narrator trying to be so sneaky ? column1: What may be the reason for the IV and blood test ? [SEP] It took me an hour to get in . Then they told me I 'd need to have an IV and get blood taken . column1: What may happen before he took a sip of wine ? [SEP] He whispered something I could n't understand and held the razor blade to his arm . I saw the slightest trickle of blood and heard his sharp intake of breath . He touched his tongue to his arm then took a sip of wine . As he turned toward me , our eyes met and held . [SEP]  (A) He gave me the razor blade to cut my arm . (B) He looked at me steadily so I would drink with him . (C) He whispered to me to give him the razor blade . (D) He licked the blood on his nicked arm .
column2: He licked the blood on his nicked arm .

column1: What might the writer and Chris do when encountering the bison ? [SEP] I saw a fresh wolf track right in the center of a fresh bison patty . I said " Whoa ! " when I came back towards the fire from getting water Sunday and saw a big male bison walking through camp , about 50 feet from Chris . My pants got soaked and dried out many times , and my shoes did so partially several times and completely once . [SEP]  (A) They will back away slowly and allow it to pass . (B) None of the above choices . (C) They will try to tame it . (D) They will run away screaming .
column2: They will back away slowly and allow it to pass .

column1: What may be the reason for them being at the airport ? [SEP] It took us about one hour to get to her place . It took me about 30 minutes to get from one end of the airport to the other ! [SEP]  (A) They are picking someone up . (B) They are home from the military . (C) Visiting to celebrate July 4th . (D) None of the above choices .
column2: Visiting to celebrate July 4th .

column1: What happened on the one Saturday I bring my staff in for the morning ? [SEP] It has n't rained during the day here for like a month . (B) It was closed . (C) I went bar shopping . (D) The weather was bad .
column2: The weather was bad .

column1: What may have caused the police to knock on the door ? [SEP] We were all in the basement , probably 30 of us when there was a knock at the door . The cops ! My friends parents were so absolutely cool and bold faced lied to the police that there was noone besides them home , even though there were 15 + cars parked in front of their house . For some reason the police accepted their story and left . [SEP]  (A) My friends parents were having a loud party . (B) None of the above choices . (C) The police needed to hear the parents ' side of the story . (D) There was a loud party .
column2: There was a loud party .

column1: Why is the narrator walking around with so much pain ? [SEP] A few nights ago , we were sitting around watching a movie . I pulled a shard of bone out of my mouth . I had a tooth pulled a month ago or something , and the wound was still giving me some pain until Sunday , when I was sitting on the couch , tonguing the place where my upper left molar once was ( this has become a habit ) , and felt something like a splinter poking out of the gum . After a few seconds of probing , I spit out a jagged little piece of bone . [SEP]  (A) None of the above choices . (B) They have oral cancer . (C) They have a mouth injury . (D) They have mouth cancer .
column2: They have a mouth injury .

column1: Why is this person looking for epiphany ? column2: This person is looking for a breakthrough .

column1: When did the narrator last eat ? [SEP] So , DO CATCH IT ! column1: What type of sport did the narrator 's friend end up playing ? [SEP] When table tennis started to become popular here in the office months ago and I 'd rave about it at home , my sister decided to take up the sport as her PE for this semester . Like me , she has thoroughly come to love the sport . So last night , I asked her how she was doing in PE and she animatedly talked about finally being able to smash the ball and winning in the doubles game she played . Suddenly she said , " Let 's buy a table ! " And I said , " Sure , but where would we put it ? " [SEP]  (A) They went with ping pong . (B) They went with lawn tennis . (C) They went with the game tennis . (D) None of the above choices .
column2: They went with ping pong .

column1: What type of sports does the narrator typically like to enjoy ? [ via ] Boston Red Sox Hall of Fame Catcher Carlton Fisk bade me welcome : yet my soul drew back , Guilty of dust and sin . column2: The narrator loves the Red Sox .

column1: Why is it strange for the narrator to have the evening to herself ?
